page.title: 18INDUSTRY - WHISKY
page.content: Stephen Stronach Age 11 My grandad is the brewer. His job is to see all the processes of whisky making are carried out properly by the men under him. The barley is made into mash. The extract is filtered off into fermenting vessels through a cooler at a temperature no more then 70deg.F to be mixed with yeast.Here it stays for 70hours in vessels called washbacks. From there it is pumped to the still house to be distilled twice. The first time the liquid comes from the still it is called low wines. From the low wines' still it is distilled again and the impurities are taken off after running for 20minutes. In 2 to 3 hours it is put into another still and there it is called yeasts. After it is mixed with low wines from the next still it is distilled again.Then it is put in oak casks and stored at least 3 years.
